instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.820-2496: What is 820-2496? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1278: What is A1278? A1278 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook or Macbook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2254, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2327, 820-2530, 820-2879, 820-2936, 820-3115..

threads.title: What does mean?
threads.message:
[LIST=1]
[*]Disconnect power cable.
[*]Hold the power button on Macbook - Duration is not important, you can move to step 2 in a matter of milliseconds.
[*]Connect the power cable whilst still holding the power button.
[*]With the power cable in, keep the power button hold for at least 5 seconds.
[*]Release the power button.
[*]Press the power button to boot the Macbook. (THIS WAY MACBOOK BOOT)
[/LIST]
A customer have this problem and what does mean? Usually SMC problem or could be more thing?

threads.title: What does mean?
threads.message:
That means there is a problem with some sensor, for current, or voltage; maybe themperature too (less probably).
Machine works in SMC bypass mode, when SMC doesn't read these sensors.
Check the schematic pages marked as power and thermal sensors.
Recently had this issue with <SIGNAL>SMC_BMON_ISENSE</SIGNAL> signal...

threads.title: What does mean?
threads.message: Or they have a 15" and  not using a 85W charger. But usually current sense issue around <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>

threads.title: What does mean?
threads.message:
Recived the laptop. It is <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2496</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
17,18 and 27,28 are both 20 ohm.
No green light but when I touch the connector or connect and disconect the board green light appears for 2,3 segs.
ISL ACOK - 3.20V

Next is to replace the SMC?

threads.title: What does mean?
threads.message: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2496</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> is ancient trash. Why replace the SMC, did you even diagnose the magsafe board? Of course you will need a green light for the machine to charge/turn on.

threads.title: What does mean?
threads.message: I took the magsafe board from <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> and same story. Green light appear only for few seconds each time I connect and disconect the ac adapter.
